dlgLine.text: Whoa, now... No need to shoot. Plenty for all of us to take, right?

dlgAnsw.text: Are you alone? I'm not in the mood for an ambush.
Plenty is good, but all is better.
I'm not going to shoot. Let's just talk. Maybe we can help each other.

dlgLine.text: Yeah, gonna go ahead and plead the fifth. Not really in the mood to get bushwhacked neither.
Why don't we just call it a draw and get on with our business.

dlgAnsw.text: Or I could shoot you and find out if you're bluffing.
Are you with someone or not? Answer the question.
I'm not going to shoot - let's talk. Maybe I can help you.

dlgLine.text: That's how you want to play this? Okay, okay... I'm going to put my pack down real slow, right?
<As he's putting down his pack, a quick motion of his hands produces an object from behind his back. He shows it to you - a grenade with one finger through the pin.>
So... I really don't want to use this thing, but if it's between getting my black ass shot or dying of hunger, can't say I like either alternative.

dlgAnsw.text: Whoa - let's talk about this.
I like your style - how about you put that away and join my group instead?
You won't do it.

dlgLine.text: Oh, now you want to talk? Crazy nigga with a grenade and suddenly it's all kumbaya in here. So - whatcha you want to talk about? Weather, school systems, how much you hate Mondays - what?

dlgAnsw.text: I'm sorry I threatened you - I never know who's going to shoot me in the back these days.
I'll trade you for that grenade.
So... Where do we go from here?

dlgLine.text: No, of course not - I... Oh, something's getting to my allergies in here, <His face crinkles as though he will sneeze> Ah... Ah...

dlgAnsw.text: What do you want?
Go ahead. Do it. I'm ready.
I'm sorry I threatened you - I never know who's going to shoot me in the back these days.

dlgLine.text: Oh, you know - three square meals a day, hot shower, spring-fresh sheets, and no more dead folk walking around would be real fucking nice.

dlgAnsw.text: I can do three of those things. Why don't you join us at our shelter?
You got any skills besides blowing yourself up?

dlgLine.text: Think about how messed up that sounds - 'I'm sorry I threatened to kill you.' Oh, shit, my bad - let's be friends now.

dlgAnsw.text: I mean it. Look, I've got a place near here - there's other survivors. You could come with us.
What do you want?

dlgLine.text: Well, I got this far, didn't I?

dlgAnsw.text: What do you want?
So... Where do we go from here?

dlgLine.text: I will!

dlgAnsw.text: I know. Do it.
Let's talk. Maybe we can help each other. What do you want?

dlgLine.text: It's about to be slightly used - that alright with you?

dlgAnsw.text: What do you want?
So... Where do we go from here?

dlgLine.text: Way I see it - we get friendly or all over the wall.

dlgAnsw.text: What do you want?
Look - we've got a shelter. I can offer you a food, a bed, protection. How does that sound?
I think you're bluffing. You won't pull that pin.

dlgLine.text: I swear - I will pull this pin and we will both fucking die if you don't drop your shit and get out of here!

dlgAnsw.text: It was a good bluff, but you're not fooling me. Let's talk.
You think you can pull that pin before I kill you? Let's find out. <Attack him>

dlgLine.text: Shit... Most fools are a mile away after I show them this.
Look - I don't want to die. But I need to eat, so if you just let me walk off with my bag, I'll let you take the rest. Please.

dlgAnsw.text: I don't want to kill you. I'm in charge of a nearby shelter - why don't you join our group?
It's your lucky day... Go, get out of here.
No one threatens me and walks away - should have pulled that pin while you were still drawing breath. <Attack him>

dlgLine.text: No, no, no. Ha... no. A bunch of rednecks all at each others throats attracting all those dead folks with their bickering?
Nuh-uh. I've seen my share of those places. There one day, bunch of corpses the next. No thanks, I do fine looking out for me, by myself, worrying only about my damn self.

dlgAnsw.text: What if the next person doesn't fall for your grenade trick? What then?
It's only going to get tougher out there. We need to stick together.
What if you get hurt? You really want to be stuck out here, waiting for those things to find you?
Fine. Good luck on your own. I'm sure you'll do fine for at least a couple more weeks.
You can leave any time. What's the harm in giving it a shot?
You seem difficult. On second thought - you go your way, I'll go mine.

dlgLine.text: Wait a sec... What if... what if I come with on a temporary basis? I'm willing to give this a shot, but if so much as one redneck calls me 'boy', I will be out of there so fast you will have to go back in time to find me.

dlgAnsw.text: Deal. Welcome to the group. What's your name?
That won't happen. I assure you.

dlgLine.text: I don't know...

dlgAnsw.text: - New Answ -

dlgLine.text: I don't like to think about that...

dlgAnsw.text: - New Answ -

dlgLine.text: Suppose if I go and I don't like it there? I want to leave any time I want to. I don't like being trapped in a bad situation. That's my offer. You alright with that?

dlgAnsw.text: Sure. I'm not running a cult.
As long as you do your part.

dlgLine.text: Okay. But it better not be filled with rednecks neither.

dlgAnsw.text: What's your name?
It's not. I've got standards.

dlgLine.text: My name's Effrem. Now, let's get out of here before the dead find us. I'm not used to making this much noise, and this... <he points to his grenade> is made out of rubber.

dlgAnsw.text: Let's try to make it back in one piece. Welcome to the group.
Ha. Glad to have you in the group. Follow me.

dlgLine.text: Yeah, I can tell you're used to talking people into watching your back for you. Alright, I'll give it a shot. Unless I find out you're running some kind of cult.

dlgAnsw.text: Nothing like that.
What's your name?

dlgLine.text: Help each other how? Like I drop my guard and you cut my throat? Nuh-uh, I've seen too many 'friendly' people introducing shotguns to their new pal's brains these last few weeks. I'm doing fine on my own, thanks.

dlgAnsw.text: We've got a shelter. I can offer food, a bed, safety in numbers. How does that sound?
I could convince you the hard way.
I need survivors like you at our shelter. And you can even leave if you don't like it there - what do you say?

dlgLine.text: No, no, no. Ha... no. A bunch of rednecks all at each others throats attracting all those dead folks with their bickering?
Nuh-uh. I've seen my share of those places. There one day, bunch of corpses the next. No thanks, I do fine looking out for me, by myself, worrying only about my damn self.

dlgAnsw.text: What if the next person you see shoots first? What then?
It's only going to get tougher out there. We need to stick together.
What if you get hurt? You really want to be stuck out here, waiting for those things to find you?
Fine. Good luck on your own. I'm sure you'll do fine for at least a couple more weeks.
You can leave any time. What's the harm in giving it a shot?
You seem difficult. On second thought - you go your way, I'll go mine.

dlgLine.text: I don't know...

dlgAnsw.text: - New Answ -

dlgLine.text: I don't like to think about that...

dlgAnsw.text: - New Answ -

dlgLine.text: Wait a sec... What if... what if I come with on a temporary basis? I'm willing to give this a shot, but if so much as one redneck calls me 'boy', I will be out of there so fast you will have to go back in time to find me.

dlgAnsw.text: Deal. Welcome to the group. What's your name?
That won't happen. I assure you.

dlgLine.text: Suppose if I go and I don't like it there? I want to leave any time I want to. I don't like being trapped in a bad situation. That's my offer. You alright with that?

dlgAnsw.text: Sure. I'm not running a cult.
As long as you do your part.

dlgLine.text: Yeah, I can tell you're used to talking people into watching your back for you. Alright, I'll give it a shot. Unless I find out you're running some kind of cult.

dlgAnsw.text: Nothing like that.
What's your name?

dlgLine.text: Okay. But it better not be filled with rednecks neither.

dlgAnsw.text: What's your name?
It's not. I've got standards.

dlgLine.text: My name's Effrem. Now, let's get out of here before the dead find us. I'm not used to making this much noise. Man, those showers better be piping hot.

dlgAnsw.text: Let's try to make it back in one piece. Welcome to the group.
Ha. Glad to have you in the group. Follow me.

dlgLine.text: Alright then. I'm keeping my eyes on you on the way out, just so you know.

dlgAnsw.text: I'm not going to kill you. Go on, get out of here.
I'm watching you too. Get your pack and get out of here.

dlgLine.text: Don't have to tell me twice.

dlgAnsw.text: <The man gracefully exits quicker than you thought was possible.>
